title: Back 'Into the Woods'
teaser: The film adaptation of "Into the Woods" is coming out on DVD. But it remains a perennial favorite for high school drama groups.
contentencoded:
The film adaptation of the musical “Into the Woods” comes out on DVD and Blu-Ray this coming Tuesday.

The film, which starred Emily Blunt, Anna Kendrick and the Oscar-nominated Meryl Streep was a holiday hit, grossing over $127 million.

But you also might be able to catch the show live at a performance near you: “Into the Woods” is a perennial favorite choice for high school drama groups looking for a challenging but doable production.

One of those schools is Georgetown Day School in Washington D.C. which will be presenting “Into the Woods” next month.

We revisit our December 2014 conversation with the director, Laura Rosberg.

  • Here & Now: ‘Into the Woods’ Hits The Big Screen, But Never Left The Stage

Guest

  • Laura Rosberg, directs theater at Georgetown Day School in Washington, D.C.
